scenarioDescription:
The K2-3 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-3 is a star with 0.6 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.56 times its radius. It is located 143.75 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 1 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

K2-3 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-3 system


K2-3 b

K2-3 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2015-05, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-3 b is 6.484 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-3 b is 1.980 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-3 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


K2-3 c

K2-3 c was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2015-05, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-3 c is 2.140 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-3 c is 1.560 that of Earth. With a mass below 5 Earth masses, a density of 2.98, and a semi-major axis of 0.1345 astronomical units, K2-3 c could, potentially, be an ocean world - a planet with no dry land.


K2-3 d

K2-3 d was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2015-05, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.21 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-3 d is 2.802 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-3 d is 1.530 that of Earth. At 2.802 Earth masses, K2-3 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-3, which contains 3 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-3 - System With 3 Exolanets
